pageContext.claim: “So make all Member Countries pay, not just the United States!”
pageContext.analysis: Trump tweeted this over a news report about how the United Nations is running short on funds. All member countries have dues, and most have paid them. But $1.3 billion in annual dues have not been paid, with the United States as a big offender. The U.S. owes $674 million for 2019, and $381 million from previous budgets, a spokesman for the Secretary-General said.
